required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diet Quality and Coronary Artery Calcification in Adults With Heterozygous Familial Hypercholesterolemia
clinical_study.official_title: Diet Quality and Coronary Artery Calcification in Adults With Heterozygous Familial Hypercholesterolemia

collaborator.agency: Centre de Recheche du Centre Hospitalier Université Laval
Centre de Recherche de l'Institut Universitaire de Cardiologie et de Pneumologie de Quebec

brief_summary.textblock: The overarching objective is to evaluate the relationship between diet and coronary artery calcification in patients with heterozygous familial hypercholesterolemia (HeFH). We will recruit adults with HeFH. They will have to complete questionnaires on diet, medication and lifestyle. Coronary artery calcification will be measured in each patient using a CT scan. Physiological and biochemical data will be collected.

detailed_description.textblock: The proposed research will deploy as cross-sectional study including treated adults with genetically-defined HeFH. Once recruited, participants will be asked to complete web-based questionnaires on diet, medication and lifestyle. They will thereafter complete a clinical assessment at the Clinical Investigation Unit of the NUTRISS-INAF Research Centre. Study staff will measure participants' height, weight, and waist circumference. Participants' blood pressure will be measured using an automatic blood pressure monitor (BP Thru, Omron) after sitting quietly for 10 minutes. Three sequential readings will be taken with three minutes between readings. Fasting blood samples (10 mL) will be collected from an antecubital vein. Body composition will be assessed with dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry (DEXA). Finally, participants will be asked to provide the full list of medication they are using, including type, dose and duration of use. Later on the same day, participants will undergo the non-contrast CT scan at the Quebec Heart and Lung Institute. Multidetector CT scans without contrast will be performed using a 256 slices helical scanner (Brilliance iCT, Philips).

primary_outcome.measure: Relationship between diet quality and coronary artery calcification (CAC)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Diet questionnaire completion and CAC measurement will be completed with a 3 weeks period.
primary_outcome.description: Diet quality indices reflecting different dimensions of diet will be used as the main exposure, including the Alternative Mediterranean Diet Index (AMED, 9-45 points), the Alternative Healthy Eating Index (AHEI, 0-100 points), the Dietary Approach to Stop Hypertension index (DASHi, 8-40 points), the healthy plant-based diet index (hPDI, 18-90 points) and the unhealthy plant-based diet index (uPDI, 18-90 points). Higher scores reflect higher diet quality, except for the uPDI which reflect lower diet quality. CAC will be measured using non-constrat CT scan. CAC scores will be quantified with the Agatston scoring method. Higher CAC scores reflect higher CAC.

secondary_outcome.measure: Relationship between diet quality and CVD risk factors.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Diet questionnaire completion and CVD risk factor measurement will be completed with a 3 weeks period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Relationship between diet quality and psychological aspects of eating
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Diet questionnaire completion and psychological aspects of eating measurement will be completed with a 3 weeks period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Relationship between diet quality and lifestyle habits (physical activity, sleep, substance use, alcohol consumption, medication adherence)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Diet questionnaire completion and lifestyle habit measurement will be completed with a 3 weeks period.

arm_group.description: Adult men and women aged 18 to 65 years with genetically-defined HeFH.

intervention.description: No intervention. Cross-section assessment of the relationship between diet, medication, lifestyle and coronary artery calcification.

study_pop.textblock: Adult men and women with genetically-defined HeFH

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Genetically-defined heterozygous familial hypercholesterolemia
Exclusion criteria:
- Homozygous FH
- Personal history of cardiovascular disease
- Personal history of cancer
